titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that any Federal employee serving under a temporary appointment who has completed at least 1 year of service in such position within the preceding 2 years shall be eligible for the Government's health benefits program, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight. period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

bill.summary: 5/25/1995--Introduced. Amends Federal law to provide health insurance benefits for temporary Federal employees completing the equivalent of at least one year of service in a particular position within the preceding two years.
